page.title: 18Tenbury Church. 1
page.content: Tenbury Church is at the bottom of Church Street which is a cul-de-sac. It is a stone church which has a clock on its Tower.The church yard is very beautiful and pleasant to walk around.In 1770 there was a flood and the main part of the church was knocked down.There was also another flood in 1886 and in the church it shows on a plaque how high it rose(1 metre high) In the balcony there are some more steps leading up to the place where the bell ringers ring the bells which is called the bell tower.There are aisles all down the sides of the pews.At the top of the chancel there is a brass cross.There is a font where babies are baptised and it had a new wooden lid 20 years ago.
